ray.rml

Interface Crossable<V extends Vector<V>>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - A more specialized vector type that supports the calculation of a cross-product.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Vector3, Vector4
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Vector3f, Vector4f

    interface Crossable<V extends Vector<V>>
    Crossable objects support calculating the cross-product, such as vectors.

    A cross-product, also called cartesian product, produces a vector that is perpendicular to the plane of the two original vectors and is useful for calculating normal (not normalized) vectors.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      V cross(V v)
      Returns the cross-product between this and the specified vectors.

    • Method Detail

      • cross

        V cross(V v)
        Returns the cross-product between this and the specified vectors.

        The vector returned is orthogonal to the plane defined by this vector and the one specified.

        Parameters:
        v - The vector used to calculate the cross-product.
        Returns:
        A new vector perpendicular to the plane of this and other vector.
